VLIB Function Reference

L1 Distance

Introduction and Use Cases

L1 Distance, also called city block distance, is a measure of the distance between two vectors.

Specification

Function

This function accepts as input two vectors, p and q, of size N. It returns the L1 distance, L1D, between p and q as a 32-bit unsigned integer as in the following equation: 
          N
    L1D = a min[ (2^15  - 1) , |pi - qi|]
          i=1

Inputs


    Parameter   Description
    -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
    *X          Pointer to array containing first vector                   (SQ15.0)
    *Y          Pointer to array containing second vector                  (SQ15.0)
     d          Number of elements in each vector                          (SQ32.0)
    *L1D        Pointer to variable to store the computed L1 Distance      (UQ32.0)

Notes

  • All arrays should be double-word aligned.
  • There should be a minimum of four elements in X and Y.
  • If the absolute difference between two corresponding vector elements is greater than 2^15-1, then that particular value is saturated to 2^15-1.

APIS

  • VLIB_L1DistanceS16
